Title: Data Scientist (GenAI)
Description:
About Fusemachines

Fusemachines is a 10+ year old AI company, dedicated to delivering state-of-the-art AI products and solutions to a diverse range of industries. Founded by Sameer Maskey, Ph.D., an Adjunct Associate Professor at Columbia University, our company is on a steadfast mission to democratize AI and harness the power of global AI talent from underserved communities. With a robust presence in four countries and a dedicated team of over 400 full-time employees, we are committed to fostering AI transformation journeys for businesses worldwide. At Fusemachines, we not only bridge the gap between AI advancement and its global impact but also strive to deliver the most advanced technology solutions to the world.

About The Role

This is a remote, contract based role for 3 - 6 months with possibility of extension. As a Data Scientist, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and implementing Machine Learning models and Generative AI solutions. You will work closely with ML Engineers, Data Engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure our AI applications are robust, scalable, and impactful.

Roles And Responsibilities

Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:


Own and develop Machine Learning solutions to solve unstructured, complex business problems
Maintain and optimize existing Machine Learning solutions and improve them with more efficient methods
Monitor models‚Äô performance in production to ensure the highest quality level, report on development status, identify risk areas and support the Data Science team
Build state-of-the-art & cost-efficient solutions leveraging GenAI models for multiple use cases (summarisation, classification, chatbots)
Perform statistical analysis on existing and new datasets to help SME stakeholders identify areas for improvement
Communicate technical solutions to non-technical stakeholders successfully
Research new methods and techniques in AI/ML to improve processes and methodologies


Required Skills

The individual applying for this role must have 2-4 years of experience as a Data Scientist building production-ready Machine Learning solutions.


Experience with common Machine Learning frameworks and methods and developing business-oriented data solutions (e.g., data mining, process optimization, predictive modeling)
Experience building GenAI solutions with LLMs and familiarity with both open-source and Proprietary LLMs
Proficiency in using Databricks for developing and managing machine learning workflows
A background in a quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Maths, Statistics, Engineering), or a PhD with a focus on quantitative methodologies. Don‚Äôt be afraid to apply for this role if you come from a different background, as long as you have relevant experience
Strong coding skills: Python (it‚Äôs a must), SQL, PySpark, and R are used across multiple projects
Hands-on experience with Machine Learning libraries such as Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, or H2O
Hands-on experience with LLMs to build RAG solutions using Hugging Face, LangChain, and/or OpenAI models
Problem-solving skills, critical thinking, and a creative mindset
Excellent written and verbal communication
Excellent organizational, problem-solving, and communication skills
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment and remain composed under pressure
A good level of English is expected (C1/C2)


Fusemachines is an Equal Opportunities Employer, committed to diversity and inclusion. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Data Scientist (w/m)
Description:
We are Deutsche Telekom IT Spain, located in a digital, scientific, and cultural hub of Spain - Valencia.




We work as part of T-Systems Iberia though with a separate structure and projects. Our team is growing, and we are looking forward to meeting more talented employees.

With our highly skilled engineers and experts, we are committed to continue developing the culture of creativity and agility, foster innovations, and be an international tech center!




Our Data team is looking for Data Scientist!

This Team is working around several directions:

Modeling customer individual network perception by Implementing initial data model representing e.g., mobile inventory, performance and usage data. Generate new insights by understanding detractor and promotor data pattern. Push positive network perception.

Drive quality improvements through cross-functional use case development. Provide technology data products based on OSS- and live network components, e.g., performance, event and line configuration data. Support centrally Fault 2 repair process.

Push data driven e2e use cases for fiber business. Powered by a consolidated data foundation as single point of truth. In order to enable a collaborative, cross-functional fiber steering




What we expect:

As a data scientist you are part mathematician, part computer scientist, and you rule the world of big data.

You will both do classical data analytics as well as create machine learning models for explaining and predicting home network events. You will cooperate closely with our business colleagues to derive actions based on your analytics to increase our home network CX.




Required Skills and experience:

‚Ä¢ CDSW (Cloudera Data Science Workbench)

‚Ä¢ Jira

‚Ä¢ Hue

‚Ä¢ Knime

‚Ä¢ ODL

‚Ä¢ ODE

‚Ä¢ SQL

‚Ä¢ Python

‚Ä¢ Pandas

‚Ä¢ PythonSpark

‚Ä¢ English level B2

‚Ä¢ Willingness to work in an agile environment.




ü§≤What do we offer you?




International, positive, dynamic, and motivated work environment.
Hybrid work model (telework/face-to-face).
Flexible schedule.
Continuous training.
Flexible Compensation Plan.
Life and accident insurance.




And many more advantages of being part of T-Systems!




If you are looking for a new challenge, do not hesitate to send us your CV! Please send CV in English.




Join our team!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Clarity AI

Clarity AI is a global tech company founded in 2017 committed to bringing societal impact to markets. We leverage AI and machine learning technologies to provide investors, governments, companies, and consumers with the right data, methodologies, and tools to make more informed decisions.

We are now a team of more than 300 highly passionate individuals from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading sustainability tech company backed by investors and strategic partners such as SoftBank, BlackRock, and Deutsche B√∂rse, who believe in us and share our goals. We are dedicated to cultivating an exceptional workplace environment. We take pride in our culture, defined by our commitment to being fact-based, diverse, transparent, meritocratic, and flexible.

We have plans to continue growing our teams globally, so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading! üìöYour work will shape and guide the sustainable decisions of investors, companies and consumers worldwide.

About The Role

We are looking for a Data Scientist with a strong scientific mindset and enough experience to help us bring societal impacts to market and make a difference. You would be part of a team of +20 international Data Scientists coming from top Academic Institutions and Tech Companies with a shared passion for data science and a growing mindset.

For more insight into the technologies used by the engineering team at Clarity AI, please explore our Tech Stack

What You'll Be Doing

Working as a Data Scientist you will be responsible for:


Monitoring and maintaining machine learning and other data science products already in production
Building new models end-to-end
Analyzing complex data sets autonomously
Participating in the development of proofs of concept
Keeping always an eye on the business needs & opportunities.
Communicating with a diverse set of stakeholders with different backgrounds


Location

The role is based in Madrid ( Remote / Hybrid )

Requirements

What You'll Need

If you feel it in your guts apply anyways (we are always open to find talent where least expected!), but this is the expected profile:


+2 years of experience working in Data Science products or PhD in ML / Applied Math / Quantitative Research / Statistics / Computer Science ... or any related field
High level in the Python data science ecosystem (Pandas, Matplotlib, Scikit-Learn, ...)
At least well acquainted with working in collaborative code bases (Git) and production code (beyond notebooks)
You care about sustainability and impact
You are willing to learn and share your own learnings
You are transparent and care about communicating effectively and constructively
Highly motivated, independent and deeply passionate about making an impact with data & science
Excellent oral and written English communication skills (minimum C1 level-proficient user)


Nice To Have


Experience in a start-up
Experience working with AWS or other cloud providers
Experience working with Docker, Gitlab & Airflow



Benefits


Equity Plans - ESOP / Phantom Stock: share our success!
Annual training budget to support your professional growth
Private healthcare coverage
Wellness and Fitness cover with Gympass!
Flexible Work Arrangements; We promote work-life balance through flexible schedules and remote work options
Global offices across New York, Madrid, Barcelona, London, Paris, and Abu Dhabi, and access to a global network of co-working spaces


More About Clarity AI ‚≠ê

Clarity AI's Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognised by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum as one of the most distinguished leaders under 40.

The leadership team has an international presence and is composed of professionals from leading tech, consulting, and banking firms, entrepreneurs, PhDs from top research institutions, and MBA graduates from top business schools.

Clarity AI has received several awards:


Investment Week - Best Sustainable Investment Research & Ratings Provider 2023
Fast Company - Most Innovative Companies 2023
The Forrester New Wave Leader: ESG Ratings, Data, and Analytics 2022
European Commission | EU Seal of Excellence 2020
World Economic Forum - Technology Pioneer 2020
World Economic Forum, Young Global Leader - Rebeca Minguela


Clarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist position

Are you a skilled Data Scientist ready to take on new challenges in the FinTech industry? We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our clients team and work on a cutting-edge project in Malaga, Spain. As a Data Scientist, you will collaborate with top professionals to develop innovative data solutions that transform massive datasets into actionable insights for business users.

What You Can Expect:


Working with a highly skilled team of professionals
Proposing and developing data solutions
Converting large datasets into meaningful, understandable figures for business users



Requirements


Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in Data Science, developing end-to-end data solutions
Proficiency in SQL or a comparable programming language such as Python, SAS, SPSS, or MATLAB
Familiarity with the concept of Model Risk Management and experience with Corporate & Investment Banking or Payments
Experience working in Agile methodologies and tools such as Jira, Confluence, GIT
Knowledge of Cloud Computing environments and principles of machine learning and MLOps
Excellent English and Spanish skills


If this position seems interesting to you, then please apply!

Title: Data Science Freelance - GSK Espa√±a - GlaxoSmithKline (Freelancer via Shakers)
Description:
Data Scientist - AI & GenAI Solutions

We create a place where people can grow, be their best, be safe, and feel welcome, valued, and included. We offer a competitive salary, an annual bonus based on company performance, healthcare and wellbeing programmes, pension plan membership, and shares and savings programme.

We embrace modern work practises; our Performance with Choice programme offers a hybrid working model, empowering you to find the optimal balance between remote and in-office work.

Overview

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Data Scientist to join our Data & Analytics & AI Team. This role is ideal for individuals who possess a unique blend of technical proficiency, business acumen, and a passion for leveraging data to drive impactful business decisions. As a Data Scientist in our team, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects that utilize artificial intelligence and generative AI technologies to transform our business processes and strategies.

About the Team:

Our Data & Analytics & AI Team is a dynamic group of professionals dedicated to harnessing the power of data and advanced analytics to drive business success. We value collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning. Our team works closely with various departments across the organization to ensure that our data-driven solutions align with and support our strategic goals. We are committed to empower an inclusive and supportive work environment where team members can thrive and grow.

Key Responsibilities:


Data Extraction and Analysis: Utilize Python and SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis, with a preference for PySpark knowledge.
AI and Machine Learning Solutions: Develop and deploy tailored AI and machine learning solutions to address complex business problems. This includes building predictive models, developing algorithms, and creating generative AI solutions that drive innovation.
Documentation and Methodology: Document deployed models, data analytical approaches, and methodologies used. Ensure that all processes are well-documented and reproducible for future reference and audit purposes.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with various teams, including marketing, finance, operations, and product development, to capture, analyze, and incorporate data into the business strategy effectively. Your insights will help shape business strategies and operational improvements.
Communication and Reporting: Translate complex data concepts into understandable language for non-technical audiences. Prepare and present data-driven recommendations and reports to stakeholders, ensuring clarity and actionable insights.
Continuous Learning: Stay updated on new developments in AI and Data Analysis technologies and practices. Participate in relevant training sessions, workshops, and conferences to continuously enhance your skills and knowledge.



Qualifications:

Experience: Experience in data analysis or similar roles, with a proven track record of delivering impactful data-driven solutions.

Technical Skills: Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and SQL. Familiarity with ETL processes and Databricks is essential. Experience in implementing ML/GenAI pipelines is highly desirable.

Data Visualization: Advanced data visualization skills, with the ability to create compelling and informative visual representations of data using tools like Power BI or similar.

Collaboration: Effective team collaboration skills, with experience working in cross-functional teams. Ability to communicate and work effectively with colleagues from diverse backgrounds and areas of expertise.

Methodology: Experience with Agile methodology is preferred. Ability to adapt to a fast-paced and evolving work environment.

Communication Skills: Strong communication skills, capable of explaining complex data to non-experts. Ability to articulate technical concepts clearly and concisely to stakeholders at all levels.

Ability to work with multidisciplinary teams specifically global ones.

Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, or a related field.

AI/GenAI Knowledge: Knowledge of AI/GenAI platforms such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or GPT-4 is essential. Familiarity with emerging AI technologies and their practical applications.

Cloud Computing: Experience with cloud computing, particularly Azure, is advantageous. Understanding of cloud infrastructure and services to support AI and data analytics solutions.

Additional Skills:


Proficiency with data visualization tools like Power BI is a plus.
Any additional certifications or coursework in AI, data science, or related fields will be considered favorably.



If you are passionate about using data to drive business results and have a strong technical background, we encourage you to apply and join our dynamic team. Together, we can harness the power of data to transform our business and achieve new heights of success.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Us

IDOVEN is a health tech startup seeking to prevent cardiac disease through AI. With our breakthrough AI-based electrocardiogram analysis platform, we work with physicians and healthcare leaders to enable early detection and diagnosis at scale.

This is a unique opportunity. With the backing of the best investors in the industry, the European Innovation Council (EIC) and Horizon 2020 European Commission, you'll have the responsibility and resources to shape the creation of a game-changing product that can save millions of lives.

Our technology is recognized with the European Seal of Excellence, supported by EIT Health (a network of best-in-class health innovators backed by the EU), and received the Healthy Longevity Catalyst Award from the U.S. National Academy of Medicine. In 2021, we were awarded at South Summit as Most Disruptive Startup and Best Health Startup. We are one of the most promising European technology companies to watch.

About You

As a Data Scientist at Idoven, you will play a crucial role in developing and implementing machine learning algorithms and models to analyze cardiovascular data. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, clinicians, and product managers, to translate complex data into actionable insights.

You will be responsible for the following:


Data Analysis and Modeling: Develop, implement, and optimize machine learning models for analyzing cardiac data. This includes data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model selection
Algorithm Development: Create and refine algorithms to improve the accuracy and efficiency of heart health diagnostics
Research and Innovation: Stay updated with the latest research in machine learning, AI, and cardiovascular health to continuously enhance our products
Collaboration: Work collaboratively with other teams to integrate models into the production environment and ensure they meet clinical standards
Data Visualization: Present data findings in a clear and concise manner to stakeholders through dashboards, reports, and presentations
Performance Monitoring: Monitor the performance of deployed models and conduct testing to validate their effectiveness
Compliance and Security: Ensure all data handling processes comply with regulatory standards and maintain high levels of data security and privacy



Requirements


Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or a related field. A Ph.D. is a plus
Experience: 2+ years of experience in data science, preferably in the healthcare or biomedical field
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, C++
Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn)
Strong knowledge of statistical analysis and data mining techniques
Familiarity with big data technologies
Domain Knowledge: Understanding of cardiovascular health and medical data is highly desirable
Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work with large, complex datasets
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Team Player: Ability to work effectively in a collaborative, fast-paced environment


Benefits

üöÄ Be part of one of the most disruptive startups in HealthTech and AI and make a difference

üèÜ Personal and professional growth as part of a fast-growing, international team

üéßNo corners cut in having the best tech equipment to do your job

üôã Unlimited remote working environment, where you can choose to work from home and attend our Madrid office whenever you want to

üìöLearning and development opportunities and training budget

üí∏ Flexible Remuneration

üë©üèª‚Äç‚öïÔ∏è Health Insurance

üòé Regular team events and Thursday happy hours

And much more!

At IDOVEN, we believe in hiring top talented people like you - ambitious, forward thinkers who want to make a difference in the world and have an impact. Apply now via the apply button or contact us via talent@idoven.ai .

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Keysight is on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights to the world‚Äôs visionaries and innovators in electronic design, simulation, prototyping, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~15,000 employees create world-class solutions in communications, 5G, automotive, energy, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. Our technical solutions ‚Äì and our methods for creating them ‚Äì help connect and secure the world. Learn more about what we do and how we do it.




About the Team:

Join Keysight's central AI team in Barcelona, a newly formed division dedicated to innovation and excellence in machine learning. As we build this new team from the ground up, you will have a unique opportunity to shape the future of our AI initiatives and make a significant impact from day one. Our team is a hub of innovation where top-tier researchers and engineers collaborate to create cutting-edge ML technologies that power our world-class products and services.




We are at the forefront of AI research, driving advancements in supervised and unsupervised learning, generative models, temporal learning, multimodal input streams, deep reinforcement learning, inverse reinforcement learning, and large language models. At Keysight, we are passionate about pushing the boundaries of what is possible. Our mission is to develop transformative ML solutions that address real-world, large-scale problems, ensuring our products lead the industry in performance and reliability.




As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to work on pioneering projects, develop state-of-the-art algorithms, and contribute to the evolution of technologies that enable the next generation of design and test products, including those for the 6G era. We foster a dynamic and collaborative environment where innovation thrives, and every team member's contribution is valued. Our cross-functional teams work closely to integrate AI/ML solutions seamlessly into our products, ensuring that we meet and exceed the needs of our customers.




If you are driven by curiosity, inspired by challenges, and ready to make a significant impact, Keysight's central AI team is the place for you.




About the Role:

We are seeking several highly qualified individuals to join our newly build AI-team as Machine Learning Engineers of different Specializations. We are dedicated to research and development in the field of machine learning within the design and test industry. As part of the team, you will have the opportunity to be the first to work on some of the most challenging technical problems and develop innovative ML solutions that will influence the future of Keysight‚Äôs products and business operations.




You'll be developing innovative ML solutions for our next-generation design and test products, enabling 6G. You'll collaborate with cross-functional teams across Keysight to ensure that the AI/ML solutions are seamlessly integrated within our products.




We're looking for someone who is self-motivated, thrives in dynamic environments, quickly builds relationships, and adapts to change and ambiguity. Strong programming skills and experience crafting, prototyping, and delivering sophisticated algorithmic solutions are essential.







We have various openings and are hiring several ML Engineers specialized in at least one of the following areas:




Machine Learning in Communications and Networks
Training, Developing, and Fine-Tuning Large Language Models (LLMs) on Custom Data for Code and Content Generation Tasks
Signal Processing and Deep Learning in Communications/Networking
Machine Learning Optimization and Design Synthesis in the Electronic Design Space
Reinforcement Learning (Deep Q-Learning)
Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs) and Transformers for Temporal Modeling
Computer Vision







Responsibilities:

Work with large datasets; extract and manipulate data using tools such as Spark SQL, command line, and scripting languages.
Design, develop, validate, and maintain predictive models and pipelines using the latest machine learning technologies.
Implement and deploy machine learning models to improve business metrics.
Develop tools to enhance the development, deployment, and lifecycle of machine learning models.
Collaborate with stakeholders, including customers and internal teams, to ensure alignment and success.
Understand and prioritize customer needs, conveying this urgency to product development teams.
Inspire and challenge development teams to achieve high performance sustainably.







Required Qualifications:

Master‚Äôs degree with 1-3 years of experience or PhD degree
In-depth knowledge of deep learning (DL) and statistical machine learning (ML)
Strong understanding of predictive modeling and machine learning algorithms (supervised and unsupervised learning, classification, regression, clustering, CNN/RNN/LSTM/Transformer, etc.)
Proficiency in programming with Python and C++
Hands-on experience with TensorFlow or PyTorch







Desired Qualifications:

Experience with the complete MLOps workflow, including data platforms, training infrastructure, and edge deployment
Passion for developing intuitive, maintainable, and well-documented software tools/apps
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, meet tight deadlines, and independently explore new ideas to improve Keysight products and operations
Creative and collaborative mindset
Strong verbal and written communication skills







What we offer:

A place within an exciting company! At Keysight we develop with our visionary, market-leading, and highly innovative customers breakthroughs that connect and secure the world. We offer you a highly competitive package. See our culture and our Benefits.







At Keysight, Inclusion, Equity & Diversity is an integral part of our core values. We believe that when people feel a sense of belonging, they can be more creative, innovative, and thrive at all points in their careers. We believe everyone should be respected in the workplace and in their communities regardless of race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, ethnicity, religion, disability, veteran status, national origin, or any protected class. We continuously challenge ourselves to grow in our understanding of inclusion by engaging in a wide variety of diversity programs, initiatives, employee network groups and mentoring/development. This is Keysight ‚Äì People and Culture - Youtube.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Locaria is a leading multilingual marketing and linguistic services agency that operates across more than 90 global markets. We blend insights, data, talent and technology to take global content further for ambitious brands. Locaria is central to the global content solution of Stagwell, the challenger advertising network.

We Have Been Recognized By The Following Awards


Home to the Association of Translation Companies‚Äô Innovator of the Year
Shortlisted for three business awards by The Drum
Named "Best Workplace for Training & Personal Development" by Adaptive
Recognised as Top mid-market language service providers by Nimdzi Insights


Joining Locaria means becoming part of a pioneering agency that combines engagement metrics with content creation processes by harnessing data from all stages of the customer journey, including awareness, consideration, and engagement. We are looking for someone who is passionate about languages and enjoys working in a multicultural environment.

We are also the winner of the Best Language Service Provider for Employee Well-Being and Overall Best Employer 2023 at the Best Employers in Localization Awards, Adaptive Globalization 2023.

Overview

We are currently looking for a Junior Data scientist to join our dynamic team, where you will be responsible to extract, analyze, and interpret data to solve complex problems and drive actionable insights within Locaria. You will work as a member of the data and data science team creating tech solutions for clients and internal stakeholders.

The Office: Barcelona

Responsibilities


Assist in collecting, cleaning, and preprocessing large volumes of structured and unstructured data from various sources.
Conduct exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and correlations within the data.
Develop and implement machine learning models and algorithms to solve specific business problems.
Perform model evaluation, validation, and optimization to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into analytical solutions.
Communicate findings and insights effectively through data visualization techniques and presentations.
Stay updated on the latest developments in data science, machine learning, and related technologies.


Required Skills


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or related field.
Solid understanding of statistical concepts and methodologies.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or similar for data manipulation and analysis.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Matplotlib, Seaborn, Tableau) to present findings effectively.
Familiarity with machine learning techniques and libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.


Equal Opportunities

You‚Äôll Live Up To The Locarian Values


We take content further
We grow together
Celebrating Individuality
Doing good along the way
With care


D&I statement

Locaria is global by nature and vastly strengthened by multicultural, international and eclectic teams. Working together to achieve shared goals, our employees recognise the importance of our core value ‚Äòcelebrating individuality‚Äô, and are supported by Locaria's breadth of cultural resources and insights that attract and retain the best talent.

We appreciate the unique perspectives and experiences that each person brings to our team and are fully dedicated to ensuring equal opportunities across the board, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability and gender identity. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let our team know.

Join our team and become part of a vibrant workplace and company culture that values and celebrates individuality!

Benefits

In return for your enthusiasm and expertise, we can offer an exciting and multicultural place of work, competitive salary, wide range of benefits, and the chance to progress your career within a truly global organization.

Some Of These Incredible Benefits Include


Holiday: You will be entitled to 22 working days paid leave per year (pro-rata in first year), excluding public holidays.
Birthday Day Off: As a gift from us you will receive an extra day off for your birthday each year. If your birthday falls on a weekend, then you can take this the Friday before or Monday after.
Flexible Working: Opportunities to work from home up to 3 days a week through our Flexible Working Policy, plus opportunities to work abroad.
Refer a Friend Scheme: We‚Äôre always on the lookout for talented people. If you refer a friend who is then hired, we will award you with a bonus depending on the level of the role being recruited for.
Rest and Recharge: The option to lengthen your standar 1 hour lunch break by 30 minutes, as long as you maintain the same number of hours you work a day.
Do Some Good Along the Way Days: In line with our 'Doing Some Good Along The Way' value, which you will have the opportunity to get involved with if you'd like to. This also allows all employees up to 2 days off a year to get involved in charity initiatives.
Annual Wellbeing Calendar: We promote a healthy working environment, which is why we have a calendar with dedicated wellbeing sessions and initiatives throughout the year.

HTML:
Locaria is a leading multilingual marketing and linguistic services agency that operates across more than 90 global markets. We blend insights, data, talent and technology to take global content further for ambitious brands. Locaria is central to the global content solution of Stagwell, the challenger advertising network.

We Have Been Recognized By The Following Awards

  • Home to the Association of Translation Companies‚Äô Innovator of the Year
  • Shortlisted for three business awards by The Drum
  • Named "Best Workplace for Training & Personal Development" by Adaptive
  • Recognised as Top mid-market language service providers by Nimdzi Insights

Joining Locaria means becoming part of a pioneering agency that combines engagement metrics with content creation processes by harnessing data from all stages of the customer journey, including awareness, consideration, and engagement. We are looking for someone who is passionate about languages and enjoys working in a multicultural environment.

We are also the winner of the Best Language Service Provider for Employee Well-Being and Overall Best Employer 2023 at the Best Employers in Localization Awards, Adaptive Globalization 2023.

Overview

We are currently looking for a Junior Data scientist to join our dynamic team, where you will be responsible to extract, analyze, and interpret data to solve complex problems and drive actionable insights within Locaria. You will work as a member of the data and data science team creating tech solutions for clients and internal stakeholders.

The Office: Barcelona

Responsibilities

  • Assist in collecting, cleaning, and preprocessing large volumes of structured and unstructured data from various sources.
  • Conduct exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and correlations within the data.
  • Develop and implement machine learning models and algorithms to solve specific business problems.
  • Perform model evaluation, validation, and optimization to ensure accuracy and reliability.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into analytical solutions.
  • Communicate findings and insights effectively through data visualization techniques and presentations.
  • Stay updated on the latest developments in data science, machine learning, and related technologies.

Required Skills

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or related field.
  • Solid understanding of statistical concepts and methodologies.
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or similar for data manipulation and analysis.
  • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Matplotlib, Seaborn, Tableau) to present findings effectively.
  • Familiarity with machine learning techniques and libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.

Equal Opportunities

You‚Äôll Live Up To The Locarian Values

  • We take content further
  • We grow together
  • Celebrating Individuality
  • Doing good along the way
  • With care

D&I statement

Locaria is global by nature and vastly strengthened by multicultural, international and eclectic teams. Working together to achieve shared goals, our employees recognise the importance of our core value ‚Äòcelebrating individuality‚Äô, and are supported by Locaria's breadth of cultural resources and insights that attract and retain the best talent.

We appreciate the unique perspectives and experiences that each person brings to our team and are fully dedicated to ensuring equal opportunities across the board, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability and gender identity. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let our team know.

Join our team and become part of a vibrant workplace and company culture that values and celebrates individuality!

Benefits

In return for your enthusiasm and expertise, we can offer an exciting and multicultural place of work, competitive salary, wide range of benefits, and the chance to progress your career within a truly global organization.

Some Of These Incredible Benefits Include

  • Holiday: You will be entitled to 22 working days paid leave per year (pro-rata in first year), excluding public holidays.
  • Birthday Day Off: As a gift from us you will receive an extra day off for your birthday each year. If your birthday falls on a weekend, then you can take this the Friday before or Monday after.
  • Flexible Working: Opportunities to work from home up to 3 days a week through our Flexible Working Policy, plus opportunities to work abroad.
  • Refer a Friend Scheme: We‚Äôre always on the lookout for talented people. If you refer a friend who is then hired, we will award you with a bonus depending on the level of the role being recruited for.
  • Rest and Recharge: The option to lengthen your standar 1 hour lunch break by 30 minutes, as long as you maintain the same number of hours you work a day.
  • Do Some Good Along the Way Days: In line with our 'Doing Some Good Along The Way' value, which you will have the opportunity to get involved with if you'd like to. This also allows all employees up to 2 days off a year to get involved in charity initiatives.
  • Annual Wellbeing Calendar: We promote a healthy working environment, which is why we have a calendar with dedicated wellbeing sessions and initiatives throughout the year.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
The Opportunity

As a Junior Data Scientist, you will be joining our Analytics department working on a hybrid basis in Madrid. This role requires a high degree of proficiency in both Spanish and English and we would invite you to submit your application in English.




You will play a crucial role in helping us achieve our goals and deliver success on behalf of our customers by building advanced statistical models and algorithms that infer and predict individual customer behaviours in real-time, based on retail, online and ecommerce transaction data.




We are experiencing a continued period of great success winning big deals with customers in Latin America, as well as across the EMEA region. This has been a big factor in our decision to build an Analytics presence in Spain to support our customers. For this role you will be working with global customers that require periodic work outside of standard hours (evening work).




Day to Day

Applying analytical theory to diverse real-world problems on large and dynamic datasets
Generating integral work products from project kick-off through to live deployment
Contributing to the development of statistical models and algorithms for integration within Featurespace products
End-to-end processing and modelling of large customer data sets
Producing materials to feedback analytic output to customers (reports, presentations, visualizations)
Working collaboratively with customers to develop and optimize models tailored to their data
Evaluating and improving analytical results on live systems
Developing an understanding of industry data structures and processes
Working with engineering/development teams to support and enhance the analytical infrastructure
Testing analytical models and their integration within the ARIC platform




About you

Must haves:

Good degree in a scientific or numerate discipline (e.g. Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Engineering) or equivalent work experience
Strong, clear, concise written and verbal communication skills in both English and Spanish
Evidence of interest in machine learning
Experience in utilising statistical models and analytical algorithms in software
Experience using Python, Java, R or another major programming language for data analysis, machine learning or algorithm development
Technical and analytical skills with the ability to pick up new technologies and concepts quickly
Problem-solving skills (especially in data-centric applications)
Strong communication skills
Ability to manage and prioritise personal workload




Great to haves:

Exposure to the handling of large, diverse, real-world data sets
Experience working in a Linux command line environment
Experience using SQL to analyse data
Experience with version control software and workflows (e.g. git)




Equal Opportunities

Here at Featurespace we are committed to being a place of equality, inclusion and respect to provide a safe environment for you to bring your authentic self to work. We know that we gain as much strength from our differences as we do our similarities. We value diversity and are dedicated to listening and learning from each other to build and maintain a positive and productive culture. We appreciate this will be an ever-evolving focus for the business to ensure everyone feels supported and has a sense of belonging.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are a global information technology company that builds high-performance, security-centric solutions that can help change the world. Enhancing people‚Äôs lives through secure, reliable advanced technology is our vision.




At Unisys, we believe in better!




Here, you can learn new skills, apply your expertise, and solve complex problems with cutting-edge technologies and solutions. You are part of a globally diverse team that supports you, drives change, and delivers successful results consistently.




Our client, a prestigious European Institution, is looking for a Data Scientist to be present at the client offices in Seville and provide their expertise in data networks.




Responsibilities

Utilize R and/or Python for data mining, data cleaning, data preparation, and data transformation.
Apply text mining and machine learning algorithms to analyze and interpret complex data sets.
Develop and implement machine learning models and algorithms to solve specific business or research problems.
Create visualizations and reports to effectively communicate findings and insights to stakeholders.
Conduct research to improve and innovate data processing techniques and analytical methods.
Stay updated with the latest advancements in data science and machine learning.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver actionable insights.
Collaborate with other researchers and data scientists to share knowledge and methodologies.
Document methodologies, processes, and results to ensure reproducibility and knowledge transfer.
Maintain clear and comprehensive records of data sources, algorithms, and outcomes.
Implement and optimize various analytical tools and techniques as needed.
Experiment with and adopt new data processing languages and tools to enhance analysis capabilities.
Present findings in English, written and verbal, to non-technical stakeholders.
Utilize Spanish for communication as needed, leveraging it as an asset for the Seville-based role.




Qualifications




Master's degree or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
At least 4 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or data modelling
Strong knowledge of data mining, cleaning, preparation, transformation, text mining, and machine learning algorithms.
Familiarity with other analytical tools is an asset.
Experience in a research context is beneficial.
Fluency in English is required.
Proficiency in Spanish is an asset.

Title: AI Data Scientist
Description:
At Tenth Revolution, we collaborate with a leading global multinational company in their sector.

We attract, develop, and grow passionate individuals who will significantly impact the digital future of our partners. Join us and be a part of our digital transformation journey.




Objective of the Position




We are looking for a talented Data Scientist specializing in Generative AI to develop a GenAI-driven application that enhances decision-making processes.




In this role, you will:

Engage in discussions about data analytics, AI, and Generative AI features with users, converting business requirements into technical concepts for Generative AI and ML engineering.
Utilize deep knowledge of data engineering to relate data to user decision-making situations.
Plan user experiences and guide data engineers and scientists to fully embrace these experiences.
Collaborate with global and regional units, as well as external partners.
Assist in the transition from project phases to successful operations, incorporating Generative AI features.




Main Tasks

Work closely with project team members and stakeholders to understand the background and business requirements of each party and provide consulting on their activities.
Translate business requirements into technical concepts, focusing on data science and ML engineering within GenAI architecture frameworks.
Data preparation
Utilizing enterprise data product concepts
Addressing data science aspects
Implementing high-performance GenAI functionalities
Create and maintain product requirement documents in an agile working environment, using tools such as Azure DevOps boards and tasks.
Operate in an international and agile DevOps environment, applying agile principles to set priorities and manage multiple stakeholders in a dynamic business setting.
Share knowledge and expertise with colleagues, promoting a culture of AI-driven innovation within the organization.
Manage communication with external vendors to validate landscape design and integration concepts.




Job Requirements




Technical & Professional Knowledge (Mandatory):




At least 4 years of experience in data science or AI, utilizing Microsoft Azure cloud components for ML and Data Science, such as Databricks and Azure Data Factory.
Experience integrating external data into MLOps frameworks.
Hands-on experience developing GenAI-based chatbots.
Experience working with large data sets, relational databases, data integration, and related technologies (e.g., SQL, Databricks).
Expert knowledge of Python, focusing on machine learning and data science libraries (e.g., Pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Hands-on experience with MLOps processes (CI/CD) and automating ML workflows (Microsoft Azure or other platforms).
Experience with software development for cloud-based applications in an agile setup (e.g., Kanban, Scrum).
Strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills in English.




Technical & Professional Knowledge (Additional Plus/Nice to Have):

Proven track record of successful AI-driven projects, preferably in an industrial setting.
Experience with GenAI technology
Experience in supply chain management or planning.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
At ING we are looking for a Senior Data Scientist







Your role and work environment:




We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic Senior Data Scientist to join our Advanced Analytics Team on the Customer Interactions and Monetization Tribe in Spain.




The responsibility of this team is to develop all type of models and analytical products in the field of Machine Learning and Big Data context for the whole Retail Organization. Our way of working mirrors our eagerness to innovate and the agile methodologies are on our daily basis.




Your key responsibilities:




As a Senior Data Scientist you will:




Positively be expected to take charge of end to end design and delivery of machine learning products across different departments in the bank. Which means all type of AI/ML products such as credit risk decision making models, churn, recommendation systems, NLP, income/expenses estimations, data categorization, clustering and segmentation, pricing, OCR, etc‚Ä¶).

Co-create and assess business with the best predictive solution and work in a cross-functional and international team formed by business colleagues, data analyst, data scientists and engineers.

Ensure the designed product meets business requirements, brings the most to the clients and that it complies with our high coding and development standards.




What are we looking for?




Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt hesitate to apply!




We are seeking a passionate and highly skilled Data Scientist used to work near to business, understand the challenges and who proposes solutions proactively, defining the appropriate analytical solution for each challenge.




Our dreamed candidate will be:

A value oriented person
With a degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science or related field.
Demonstrable experience in data analysis, visualization and building predictive models (specially supervised ones).
Strong knowledge of languages such as SQL, Python and distributed computing tools (Spark, Hadoop, Hive, etc.) as well as machine learning libraries.
Used to work with Git for peer review and code repositoring.
Ability to communicate technical findings clearly and comprehensibly even for non-technical audiences.
Teamwork skills and ability to tackle complex challenges.




What do we offer?




The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but‚Ä¶ What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.




Check out what is waiting for you!




Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.




Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn‚Äôt take up your time or your cravings.




Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!




Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).




Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.




Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids‚Ä¶




Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.




Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!




More vitality and more belonging

360¬∫ care of the employee (physical, mental, social connection & purpose).

Physiotherapy service on site.

Runners club with your own trainer.

Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.

Gympass service.

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+) & Leonas.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Be part of something revolutionary

At o9 Solutions, our mission is clear: be the Most Valuable Platform (MVP) for enterprises. With our AI-driven platform ‚Äî the o9 Digital Brain ‚Äî we integrate global enterprises‚Äô siloed planning capabilities, helping them capture millions and, in some cases, billions of dollars in value leakage. But our impact doesn‚Äôt stop there. Businesses that plan better and faster also reduce waste, which drives better outcomes for the planet, too.

We're on the lookout for the brightest, most committed individuals to join us on our mission. Along the journey, we‚Äôll provide you with a nurturing environment where you can be part of something truly extraordinary and make a real difference for companies and the planet.

About the role

o9 Solutions is looking for an experienced, talented, and motivated Lead Data Scientist to come join our global team in NA or EMEA. As part of this Data Science team, you will be involved in the end-to-end delivery of our supply chain planning products and building advanced forecasting models with Predictive Analytics, Machine Learning and AI with algorithms such as R, and Python. These models will have used cases for Demand Planning, Supply Planning, Market Mix Modeling, Price Elasticity, New Product Planning, Store Assortment, Market Optimization, and more!

You will be key in understanding the customers supply chain problems, designing solutions, developing, and deploying models, validating, and maintaining those models.

A successful candidate will bring a Master‚Äôs in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, and 5+ years of experience in hands-on modeling in R or Python, in a supply chain forecasting capacity. You will enjoy working directly with customers and our larger o9 Data Science team in India and NA.

What you‚Äôll do for us:

Research, design, build, deploy, and validate new and existing machine learning models and predictive analytics for advanced forecasting in supply chain demand planning that will drive our customers growth from insights that are allow for better decision making
Apply a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, regression, neural nets, time series, optimizations etc.) to their real-world advantages/drawbacks for insights internally and externally
Collaborate with solution architects, business operations specialists, engineers, data scientists, product managers, and internal/external business teams to make sure the models are aligned with business objectives and customer needs
Develop machine learning models for segmentation and optimization
Provide visualization of complex data sets that includes mathematical models, algorithms, and robust analytics
Produce recommendations and use statistical techniques that answer key product questions
Provide on-going support for development of demand planning forecasting and predictive analysis.
Be a storyteller to explain the ‚Äúwhy and how‚Äô‚Äù of your data driven recommendations to cross-functional teams and customers
Guide junior data scientists and oversee their activities to ensure proper alignment/execution of their activities, and maintain high coding standards and best practices within organization

What you‚Äôll bring:

Experience: 5+ years of data science and data analytics experience.
5+ years‚Äô experience in supply chain planning analysis that specialize in: Demand Planning, Predictive Analysis, Demand Forecasting, Supply Planning, Inventory Market Optimization, Store Segmentation, Market Mix Optimization, New Product Planning, or similar.
Experience in building scalable ML frameworks for demand sensing including identifying and collecting relevant input data, feature engineering, tuning, and testing.
Experience developing experimental and analytics plans for data modeling processes with the ability to accurately determine and resolve problems
Experience gathering data requirements for statistical predictive analytics research that drives market research, product innovation, and implementation in a supply chain space
Strong presentation and communications skills with ability to communicate complex analytical or technical concepts to audiences with limited analytical or technical background
Experience in time series forecasting in scale using heuristic based hierarchical best-fit models using algorithms like exponential smoothing, ARIMA, prophet and custom parameter tuning
Education: Master‚Äôs in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, or related field
Skills: R, Python, Pyspark, Machine Learning, SQL, building models in platforms like Power BI or Tableau
Characteristics: You thrive in a fast paced, challenging environment, where this is much white space and problem solving is at the heart of what drives your analysis
We really value team spirit: Transparency and frequent communication is key. At o9, this is not limited by hierarchy, distance, or function

Preferred Experience‚Ä¶

Exposure to distributed data/computing tools: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Gurobi, or related Big Data technologies
Experience with Deep Learning frameworks such as Keras, Tensorflow or PyTorch is preferable
Experience in implementing planning applications will be a plus

How the process works‚Ä¶

Apply by clicking the button below.
You‚Äôll be contacted by our recruiter, who‚Äôll fill you in on all things o9, give you some background about the role and get to know you. They‚Äôll contact you either via video call or phone call - whatever you prefer.
During the interview phase, you will meet with the Hiring Manager for 30 minutes. The recruiter will contact you after the interview to let you know if we‚Äôd like to progress your application.
Your application has progressed! Meet with a new panel for a final round of interviews for 30 minutes each.
Our recruiter will let you know if you‚Äôre the successful candidate. Good luck!

More about us‚Ä¶

With the latest increase in our valuation from $1.1B to $3.7B, o9 Solutions is one of the fastest-growing technology companies in the world today. Our mission is to digitally transform planning and decision-making for the enterprise and the planet. Our culture is high-energy and drives us to aim 10x in everything we do.

Our platform, the o9 Digital Brain, is the premier AI-powered, cloud-native platform driving the digital transformations of major global enterprises including Google, Walmart, ABInBev, Starbucks, and many others.

Our headquarters are located in Dallas, with offices in Amsterdam, Paris, London, Barcelona, Madrid, Milan, Munich, Bangalore, Tokyo, Seoul, Sydney, Sao Paulo and Toronto.

o9 is an equal opportunity employer and seeks applicants of diverse backgrounds and hires without regard to race, colour, gender, religion, national origin, citizenship, age, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by law

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
OUR HIRING PROCESS:


We will review your application against our job requirements. We do not employ machine learning technologies during this phase as we believe every human deserves attention from another human. We do not think machines can evaluate your application quite like our seasoned recruiting professionals‚Äîevery person is unique. We promise to give your candidacy a fair and detailed assessment.
We may then invite you to submit a video interview for the review of the hiring manager. This video interview is often followed by a test or short project that allows us to determine whether you will be a good fit for the team.
At this point, we will invite you to interview with our hiring manager and/or the interview team. Please note: We do not conduct interviews via text message, Telegram, etc. and we never hire anyone into our organization without having met you face-to-face (or via Zoom). You will be invited to come to a live meeting or Zoom, where you will meet our INFUSE team.
From there on, it's decision time! If you are still excited to join INFUSE and we like you as much, we will have a conversation about your offer. We do not make offers without giving you the opportunity to speak with us live. After all, we consider our team members our family, and we want you to feel comfortable and welcomed.


We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Scientist to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, machine learning, and statistical modeling, with a keen ability to translate data insights into actionable business strategies.

Key Responsibilities:


Develop and implement AI/ML models and algorithms, particularly focusing on LLM.
Managing the entire data lifecycle, from data collection and cleaning to model training, deployment, and inference.
Be proficient in utilizing various data engineering tools and frameworks to ensure seamless data flow and possess the ability to build, train, and deploy machine learning models in production environments.
Analyze complex datasets using strong analytical skills to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Conduct a thorough evaluation of AI and machine learning tools and strategically adopt those that have the potential to improve key business processes significantly.
Collaborate on defining and implementing KPIs to measure business success based on insights derived from machine learning models and data analysis.
Ensure data quality by cleaning and validating results data for accuracy.
Analyze current data structures, tagging, and quality standards. Recommend improvements and identify and address data anomalies.


Qualifications:


Master's degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, financial engineering, or a similar field.
Minimum of 3 years of proven experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst.
E2E data flow, model training/deployment and inference expertise
Expertise in developing and deploying AI/ML models using Python libraries, including pre-processing, analysis, model selection, and performance evaluation.
Demonstrated experience with Generative AI, feature repository development for AI/ML models, LLM embeddings and fine-tuningon custom datasets for specific use cases.
Strong analytical skills for data manipulation, cleaning, and insightful reporting with meticulous attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong proficiency in SQL and experience working with relational databases.
Experience in business analysis and design, data modeling (including planning, requirement gathering, and documentation).
Technical expertise in data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically and provide innovative solutions.
Exceptional communication skills to effectively present findings and recommendations.


We offer:


Competitive compensation, which will take into account the experience and skills of the candidate. Form of payment - monthly, based on Invoice - Bank transfer/Payoneer
Remote, Work schedule: 5/2 (8-hour working day) from 13:00 to 22:00 EEST (incl. 60-min breaks, Flexible schedule is possible)
Interesting and long-term project
We support work-life balance and offer paid annual leave and paid sick days
Shorter Fridays (6 working hours) in Summertime.
Opportunities for professional development and career growth


Our recruitment process:


Interview with HR + one-way video interview
Test tasks
Technical interview with Team
Final interview with the Technical director

‚óè Sector en auge donde ver√°s el impacto de tu trabajo en el d√≠a a d√≠a: El agua va a ser un bien cada vez m√°s escaso y ayudamos a que su gesti√≥n sea lo m√°s eficiente posible, aportando tu granito de arena a la mejora del medio ambiente.


Adem√°s de estos beneficios, podr√°s disfrutar de muchos otros:

Como eventos de teambuilding, plataformas de formaci√≥n, catering subvencionado al 50% o de la plataforma iFeel, entre otros, con el objetivo de que tu d√≠a a d√≠a en Idrica sea mucho mejor.

‚óè Poder mantener una conversaci√≥n fluida en ingl√©s, ya que trabajar√°s con equipos de diferentes pa√≠ses y tanto las reuniones como la comunicaci√≥n escrita puede ser en ingl√©s.

‚óè Grado o Ingenier√≠a

‚óè Python (pandas, scikit-learn, psycopg2, plotly), Spark, SQL

‚óè Experiencia en:

- Ingenier√≠a de datos

- An√°lisis de datos

- Machine learning, especialmente time series y deteccion de eventos poco frequentes.

‚óè Deseables:

- Docker

As√≠ que, si quieres causar un impacto en el mundo, hacerlo de la mano de un equipo que te ayudar√° en lo que necesites y en una empresa donde las oportunidades de crecimiento son reales,


¬°Idrica es tu sitio!

Title: Marketing Data Scientist
Description:
Overview




Keysight is on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights to the world's visionaries and innovators in electronic design, simulation, prototyping, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~15,000 employees create world-class solutions in communications, 5G, automotive, energy, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. Our technical solutions - and our methods for creating them - help connect and secure the world. Learn more about what we do and how we do it.




Our powerful culture has led to us being independently recognized on Fortune 100's Best Companies List and we are "Great Place to Work" Certified. We're driven, collaborative, ethical, and curious, and we value all ideas, especially bold ones. And our culture extends far beyond our own walls. Our corporate social responsibility efforts support our communities, nurture the next generation of engineers, and promote environmental sustainability.




At Keysight, Inclusion, Equity & Diversity is an integral part of our core values. We believe that when people feel a sense of belonging, they can be more creative, innovative, and thrive at all points in their careers. We believe everyone should be respected in the workplace and in their communities regardless of race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, ethnicity, religion, disability, veteran status, national origin, or any protected class. We continuously challenge ourselves to grow in our understanding of inclusion by engaging in a wide variety of diversity programs, initiatives, employee network groups and mentoring/development. This is Keysight - People and Culture - YouTube

Responsibilities

Keysight Global Marketing (KGM) is hiring a Marketing Data Scientist who will collaborate with team members to implement machine learning models leveraging data from sources across the sales and marketing pipeline. You will be joining a small, highly visible, analytics and operations team reporting into the CMO.







Primary Responsibilities




Use SQL and Python to build models leveraging data from multiple data sources across a multi-touch multi-contact organization-based customer journey
Explain model performance and provide recommendations for feature generation and selection to business users with limited experience in ML concepts
Build and deploy machine learning models leveraging packages like Scikit-learn and Pandas
Design reporting dashboards within Domo, our BI platform, following data visualization best practices
Identify gaps in processes and data collection to proactively ensure data quality across the marketing organization
Collaborate with fully remote teammates: communicating needs, coordinating work, and communicating timelines and deliverables across global time zones




Qualifications




BA in marketing, engineering, statistics, economics, computer science, or equivalent work experience
2+ years building and tuning machine learning models
2+ years working with B2B marketing data with an understanding of the lead journey, lead qualification processes, account-based marketing (ABM) metrics, and the marketing and sales pipeline
2+ years executing work as part of a project-based team (agile project management experience preferred)
1+ years working with Domo or 2+ years working with other BI platforms
Strong understanding of statistics and practical application of machine learning models
Ability to independently build, evaluate performance of, and tune machine learning models
Proficiency in Python; proficiency with git and version control; proficiency in working with APIs
Excellent interpersonal communication skills ‚Äì especially in the context of a fully-remote team and work environment

Title: Data Scientist (Honey Team)
Description:
Job Description

Hi there!

We are Semrush a global IT company developing our own product a platform for digital marketers. New stars are born here so don t miss your chance.

This is our role Data Scientist for those who want to turn ideas into reality using code algorithms and maybe a bit of magic

Tasks in the role

Prompt Engineering Develop and refine prompts to optimize NLP model performance


Text Generation Design implement and optimize models for producing coherent contextually appropriate text outputs while maintaining high standards of text quality
Text Classification Develop and improve models to accurately categorize and label text data such as determining formality levels and classifying topics
Model Evaluation Continuously evaluate and improve models using standard NLP metrics and develop custom metrics to ensure high performance accuracy and text quality


Requirements

Who we are looking for


3+ years of experience.
Proficiency in writing clean maintainable Python code.
Experience with natural language processing (NLP).
Experience with open-source LLMs like LLaMa and Phi-3 and API-based LLMs such as GPT Claude AI Gemini.
Strong understanding of the principles of machine learning algorithms probability theory statistics linear algebra.
Experience working with databases.


They say there are no perfect candidates but that might well be you if


Proficiency with visualization tools
Experience using Docker
Ability to write tests for code
Experience conducting code reviews
You share our common values Trust because we prefer to speak up and be our true selves Sense of Ownership because it s not worth wasting time on something you don t believe in and enthusiasm for Constant Changes because we are always looking to make things better


A Bit About The Team

You can get to know the team better at one of the interviews but some brief information about future colleagues will be useful now.

Honey team is responsible for the data science aspects of content tools such as Content Marketing Toolkit ContentShake and GoodContent Hub. Focusing on NLP and ML components we work closely with other development teams to enhance product capabilities and deliver innovative solutions.

We will try to create all the right conditions for you to work and rest comfortably


It s up to you to decide what work format works best for you. You can #wfo #wfh or mix both.
Flexible working day start
Unlimited PTO
Hobby benefit
Breakfast snacks and coffee at the office
Corporate events
Training courses conferences
Gifts for employees


Finally a Little More About Our Company

We ve been developing our product for 15 years and have been awarded G2 s Top 100 Software Products Global and US Search Awards 2021 Great Place to Work Certification Deloitte Technology Fast 500 and many more. In March 2021 Semrush went public and started trading on the NYSE with the SEMR ticker.

10 000 000+ users in America Europe Asia and Australia have already tried Semrush and over 1 000 people around the world are working on its development. The Semrush team is constantly growing.

Semrush is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race religion creed color national origin sex pregnancy sexual orientation gender identity gender expression age ancestry physical or mental disability or medical condition including medical characteristics genetic identity marital status military service or any other classification protected by applicable local state or federal laws. All employment decisions are based on business needs job requirements merit and individual qualifications.

Python, NLP, GPT, Claude AI, Gemini

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are looking for a Customer-Facing Machine Learning Engineer to join our growing team of data experts.

Responsibilities

Work directly with customers to understand their greatest problems and design and implement solutions using data.
Acquire, clean, and improve data quality through Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes to ensure data readiness for analysis and modeling.
Deploy and integrate machine learning models into production environments, ensuring seamless functionality across various platforms such as APIs, pipelines, automation systems, and chatbots.
Implement and manage continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines to automate testing, building, and deployment processes.

Requirements:

+3 years of experience in Python and Java (Spark) programming languages.
+3 years of experience with Spark for large-scale data processing.
Understanding and experience with machine learning models, both supervised (e.g., regressions, random forests, SVMs) and unsupervised (e.g., PCA, clustering).
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms such as Azure and AWS.

Conditions:

Full-time job
Location: Madrid (hybrid)
The role requires travel to customer sites one or two times a week.
Budget: 45-55k

If you like it, send me your CV today!

Montreal Associates is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.


Montreal Associates is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.
